alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 27 at 9:52AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCE WARNING for the following areas...the Eastern Sierra in Mono County and the Eastern Sierra in Inyo County * WHAT...The avalanche danger is HIGH at all elevations. Dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to continue into tomorrow morning. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virgina Lakes to the north to Bishop Creek to the south. * WHEN...10 AM PST Tuesday to 7 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...A large atmospheric river will bring periods of heavy rain on snow below treeline stressing an already weak snowpack. Strong winds and heavy snowfall at higher elevations will also create widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into lower elevations. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
